content.introduction:
Checks whether a function declaration has parameters that are top level

const
.

const
 values in declarations do not affect the signature of a function, so
they should not be put there.

Examples:

void
 
f
(
const
 
string
);
   
// Bad: const is top level.


void
 
f
(
const
 
string
&
);
  
// Good: const is not top level.

Options
Â¶






IgnoreMacros
Â¶


If set to 
true
, the check will not give warnings inside macros. Default
is 
true
.
